oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-02-01 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 1, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Cowboy Copas (host/performer), guest performer Jimmy C. Newman (although Rusty & Doug were advertised as the guests for this week on the previous show), and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 956th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Cowboy Copas; Rod Brasfield; Jimmy C. Newman; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Cowboy Copas -- Down in Nashville, Tennessee (Cowboy Copas) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Cowboy Copas) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Cowboy Copas) -- Grant Turner and Cowboy Copas introduce Jimmy Newman -- Cry, Cry, Darling (Jimmy C. Newman) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Cowboy Copas) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Tommy Jackson -- Buffalo Gals (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Cowboy Copas talks -- From The Manger To The Cross (Cowboy Copas) -- Cowboy Copas and Grant Turner introduce Chet Atkins -- Wildwood Flower (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Copas, Cowboy; Newman, Jimmy C.
